data.question: What is the empirical formula of the synthesized material?
data.answer: C51 H36 N2 O8 Si Zn2

data.question: What method was used for the cycloaddition of 1deprot and 1*deprot with benzyl azide?
data.answer: The 'click' chemistry method was used for the cycloaddition.

data.question: Is the crystal system of the synthesized material triclinic?
What is the space group of the synthesized material?
Was TEAF used as a fluoride source for the deprotection process?
What was the purpose of using tetraethylammonium fluoride (TEAF) in the synthesis process?
data.answer: TEAF was used as the fluoride source for the removal of the trimethylsilyl (TMS) groups during the deprotection process.

data.question: Did the synthesis of the material involve a heating step at 80 Â°C?
What was the yield percentage of the pale yellow crystals after the synthesis?
Was the synthesized material characterized using MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry?
What was the role of sodium ascorbate in the 'click' reaction process?
data.answer: Sodium ascorbate was used to facilitate the 'click' reaction by acting as a reducing agent for the copper(II) sulfate catalyst.

data.question: Is the synthesized material permanently microporous according to the text?
What analytical technique was used to confirm the retention of porosity in the material after deprotection?
data.answer: Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) and gas adsorption measurements were used.

data.question: What was the purpose of solvent-exchanging the synthesized material with THF?
data.answer: Solvent-exchanging with THF was done for gas adsorption experiments to analyze the material's porosity.

data.question: Was the synthesized material's structure determined using single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis?
What was the main goal of selectively deprotecting the external surfaces of the MOF crystals?
data.answer: The goal was to functionalize the external surfaces independently with a different organic molecule than the one used for the interior.

data.question: Did the synthesis involve the use of a solvent-based, selective deprotection strategy?
What was the significance of using 'click' chemistry in the post-synthetic modification of the MOF?
data.answer: 'Click' chemistry allowed for the selective and efficient functionalization of the MOF's internal and external surfaces with different organic molecules.

data.question: Was the synthesized MOF material characterized by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD)?
What was the role of copper(II) sulfate pentahydrate in the synthesis process?
data.answer: Copper(II) sulfate pentahydrate was used as a catalyst for the 'click' reaction.

data.question: How was the internal deprotection of the MOF achieved for further functionalization?
data.answer: Internal deprotection was achieved using a more dilute solution of TEAF in THF.
